message.content:
cs.IR, cs.CL, cs.DL, cs.SI, cs.CR 

This paper is primarily focused on improving the crawling and indexing of newly created web pages, which is a key problem in information retrieval (cs.IR). The paper also discusses the use of search engine click logs to understand user demands, which falls under the category of natural language processing and computational linguistics (cs.CL). The proposed metric for prioritizing crawling of ephemeral pages could also be seen as a machine learning problem, which falls under deep learning (cs.DL) and statistical learning (cs.SI). Finally, the paper discusses the importance of efficient resource allocation for crawling and recrawling, which could be seen as a problem in computer security (cs.CR).
